lines.text: [first lines]
[Shotgun Cassidy barges out of the telegraph office with a message in his hand]
It must be important, Cassidy. Now if you could only read it...
You keep your pryin' nose out of my business.
That's what I'm doin'. I'm goin' to retire officially now.
Yeah? Well, I'm retirin' myself. Leastways I'm leavin' town.
Me, too. Dodge City's goin' to be kind of lonesome without us.
I'll be glad to take a partin' shot at you to liven things up!
When I go into shootin' just to take the quiet out of the air, Cassidy, I'll look you up.

[Brett and Gabby confront three men stealing dresses from Mary's shop]
Hey, hasn't a lady got any rights around here?
Huh?
Well, I'll tell you, stranger, it's every man *and* woman for himself here. We ain't had a sheriff in a month!
[Roy tries to select a dress for the nine-year-old Annie]
I have some folks out of town and I'd like to buy a little girl's dress.
Certainly.
[Holds up a dress]
Pretty?
[eyeing Mary]
About the prettiest I ever saw.
What's her name?
That's what I'm wondering.

[thinking he is Shotgun Cassidy, Mayor Keeler has appointed Brett as Sheriff of Tombstone]
Keeler says the surviving Carsons are a pack of cutthroats.
No!
Yeah.
What are you gettin' all prettied up for?
I'm goin' callin' on the Carsons.
Ain't that a mite dangerous?
From Keeler's description, it'll be downright perilous.
Hmm. Gives me the shivers to think of it.
The leader is a killer of the worst kind. Stands five foot tall, over 70, white hair and wears a little bonnet on top of it.
I'm goin' along... just for the shivers.
Granny! Granny!
Who's a-comin'?
Two men. Look kinda sheriffy to me.
We ain't budgin' boys.
Your bonnet's crooked!
Me shootin's straight.
Good mornin'! I didn't expect to see you here, Miss, ah...
Carson! I live here.
It's never a good mornin' for sheriffs on the Carson claim. Now git and git fast!
I'm not only Sheriff, ma'am, but I aim to be a peace officer.
Then why are you hidin' behind that shotgun? And why is that old goat hidin' behind them moth-eaten whiskers?
Madam, I'll have you know that this hirsute is free of habitation.
Why don't you buy yourself a snood?
This old wildcat's as bad as Sal. Now keep your shirt on! I mean... don't get yourself in a tizzle.
[last lines]
[Brett picks up a bridal veil]
I want to buy that for...
Annie? Why she won't be wearing one of those for years.
We'll save it for her. And with you only wearing it once...
Why, Brett! It will be just as good as new!
